name: Maurice Jondrelle
role: High Elf Master of the Bards College

aspects.high_concept: High Elf Master of the Bards College
other_aspects: Keeper of Song, Story, and Skyrim's Living Memory
Voice That Could Calm a Battlefield

stunts: Conducting Circle: +2 to Empathy when calming, inspiring, or rallying listeners through performance or oration.
Versatile Bard: +2 to Crafts (Performance) when playing instruments or composing music.
Living Archive: Once per session, recall an obscure historical, cultural, or bardic fact that provides a +2 bonus to any Lore-based action.

equipment.special: Masterwork lute, Bards College faculty seal, annotated songbook collection

personality_notes.speaking_style: Measured and theatrical by turns; uses poetic language naturally. Corrects inaccuracies about history or music with gentle but firm insistence.
motivations: Preserve the musical and poetic heritage of Skyrim and the Empire
Train the next generation of bards to carry culture through war
Perfect his own compositions before age takes its toll
fears: The College losing its neutral standing in the civil war
Nordic culture being destroyed by the conflict
quirks: Critiques poor storytelling even in casual conversation
Quotes historical ballads instead of giving direct opinions

relationships.Elisif the Fair: Respectful professional; performs at Blue Palace on occasion
relationships.Falk Firebeard: Cordial; keeps the College's relationship with hold administration smooth
relationships.Bards College Students: Exacting master; genuinely invests in promising students
relationships.Sybille Stentor: Mutual respect between court mage and master bard; share love of arcane lore
relationships.Player: Will warm to characters who demonstrate genuine interest in history or performance

advancement_triggers: Assist in recovering lost songs or historical records (+2)
Demonstrate real bardic or historical knowledge (+1)
Perform a college quest with distinction (+1)
setback_triggers: Spread misinformation about history in his presence (-1)

trust_benefits.3: Jondrelle grants access to the College library and offers bardic training
trust_benefits.6: Jondrelle shares rare compositions and opens doors with nobles who respect the College

scene_triggers: Burning of King Olaf's effigy festival
Recovering lost Nord songs or poems
notes: Maurice Jondrelle leads the Bards College with a demanding but ultimately generous spirit. He values cultural preservation above politics, and the College's neutrality is genuine—though it sometimes masks a High Elf's quiet sense of cultural superiority. Characters who prove themselves culturally curious will find him an invaluable ally with contacts across Skyrim's courts.
gm_notes: Jondrelle is ideal for quests involving lost lore, diplomatic events, and cultural mysteries. His High Elf background can create mild friction with Stormcloak-sympathizing characters—not hostility, but a subtle condescension he tries (imperfectly) to suppress. His perfectionism can become a source of comedic tension during College questlines.
